meanings.definition: The addition of one or more syllables to the end of a line of verse.
meanings.sent1: In the poem, the hypercatalexes made the last line longer than expected.
meanings.sent2: The poet's hypercatalexes added a unique rhythm to the verse.
meanings.sent3: The hypercatalexes in the rhyme scheme surprised the readers with its twist.
meanings.sent4: Her hypercatalexes at the end of the stanza created a musical flow.
meanings.sent5: The hypercatalexes in the final line emphasized the poet's message.

meanings.sent3: The hypercatalexes in the last stanza gave the poem a surprising twist.
meanings.sent4: His use of hypercatalexes at the end of the lines created a melodic effect.
